Activity: Wake up, have a quick breakfast and review the week's goals: finalize architecture, oversee integration, implement security, and coordinate with DevOps.
Log in to the system, check emails and prioritize tasks. Review the current state of the technology infrastructure architecture diagrams and documentation.

Deep dive into the trade execution module design. Identify potential bottlenecks and areas for optimization. Prepare a list of questions for @SDEV-1 and @SDEV-2 regarding the current implementation status and any challenges they've encountered.

Email @SDEV-1, @SDEV-2: Subject: Trade Execution Module Review - Questions and Discussion.  Request a meeting to discuss the trade execution module, focusing on performance, error handling, and integration points.
Work on defining the API specifications for communication between the trade execution module and the risk management module. Document the data formats, error codes, and expected response times.
Lunch Break - Review industry articles on high-performance trading systems and network security best practices.

Meeting with @SDEV-1 and @SDEV-2 to discuss the trade execution module. Review code snippets, discuss potential optimizations, and address any concerns regarding integration with other modules.  Document action items from the meeting.
Begin drafting the security architecture document, focusing on data encryption, access control, and intrusion detection. Consult NIST guidelines and industry best practices.
Research and evaluate different encryption algorithms and key management strategies.  Prioritize algorithms that offer a balance of security and performance.

Email @DEVOPS-1: Subject: Infrastructure Security Requirements - Discussion. Request a meeting to discuss security requirements for the infrastructure, including firewall configurations, intrusion detection systems, and vulnerability scanning.
End of day. Briefly review tasks completed and plan for tomorrow.
